title: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 14 at 1:07PM MDT by NWS
description: Snowmelt from record high snowpack in the Upper Dolores River Basin has resulted in high flow along the Upper Dolores River. In addition, rapid snowmelt has flooded multiple county roads across Dolores, San Miguel and Montrose counties, which have impacted access to the Dolores River. Please visit Colorado BLM for updates on recent closures. Closure on

title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 1:55AM CDT by NWS
description: ...Elevated Fire Weather Conditions for this Afternoon... The combination of low relative humidity values, gusty southerly winds, and dry fuels will result in elevated fire weather conditions for this afternoon over much of southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa, and southwest Wisconsin--as well as areas where the snowpack has recently melted north of Wisconsin Highway 29.

description: ...SNOWMELT AND ASSOCIATED FLOODING OUTLOOK FOR THE DEVILS LAKE BASIN... Overland flooding may increase in coverage through this weekend into next week across the Devils Lake Basin. title: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 1:55AM CDT by NWS
description: ...Elevated Fire Weather Conditions for this Afternoon... The combination of low relative humidity values, gusty southerly winds, and dry fuels will result in elevated fire weather conditions for this afternoon over much of southeast Minnesota, northeast Iowa, and southwest Wisconsin--as well as areas where the snowpack has recently melted north of Wisconsin Highway 29.

title: Hydrologic Outlook issued April 13 at 5:08AM CDT by NWS
description: ...CONTINUED MELTING SNOW PACK AND RUNOFF TO LEAD TO ADDITIONAL FLOODING INTO THE WEEKEND... The unseasonably warm airmass will remain in the Great Lakes through Saturday, resulting in daytime temperatures climbing to 15 to 30 degrees above normal. Snow water equivalent values are anomalously high across far northern Wisconsin and Upper Michigan. Excessive
